alert.note: Alert for Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountain Valley Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 6:42PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Fremont, southwestern Teller, northeastern Custer and west central Pueblo Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 641 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking developing strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Guffey to Royal Gorge to 8 miles west of Junkins Burn Scar. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Junkins Burn Scar, Florence, Cripple Creek, Victor, Royal Gorge, Florissant, Penrose, Canon City, Beulah and Wetmore. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
